revised_title: Abnormal Trichromatic Colour Vision Due to Shifts in the Green-Sensation Curve
tldr: The authors investigate a case of abnormal trichromatic colour vision caused by a shift in the green-sensation curve. They discuss the effects of such a shift on colour perception and present the results of a series of measurements, showing that these shifts can sometimes occur. They also explain how to detect these shifts using a simple spectrum test.
